TopicTitle: what is going to be the first planet/moon are you going to land on? in the .17 update

Articles.Content:
so what planet/moon are you going to land on first?

my first target would probably be the red planet because of the thinner atmosphere so it would be easier for a lander to get into space and it may have lower gravity than kerbin who knows

link with some pics of planets/moons -----> http://imgur.com/a/clX81#eyLnn
The one I'll crash into first when doing an uncontrolled burn:)
The first one I intersect with.

Kerbin.

Explanation: Practice.

I will Probably Try land On the large green one but I will Probably Shoot strait through it because it it is the gas giant

I just like the colour
Will They take away Minimus because I will be Mad
RE bprplane: no man
Most likely eve but I probably won't come back.

I want to try for a grand tour, with fly-bys of everything...

I think that stuff is so cool, where you let gravity fly your ship.

I want to try for a grand tour, with fly-bys of everything...

I think that stuff is so cool, where you let gravity fly your ship.
What's that new probe looking thingy Nova used in his Explorator mission? If it's going to be added, I'll probably recon as many planets as I can.

First, I plan to send out a probe that will pass by each of the new planets in one go - I'll probably try to slingshot around the Sun, taking me to Charr, which will fling me to Eve, which will fling me to the Desert planet, which will fling me to the Gas giant and then I'll just leave my probe be from then on. It will be quite the journey, I probably will record it (if it works, of course).

The first one I will step on shall be the Desert planet.
I'm going to land on the gas planet- oh wait..
I'm sure there will be new parts or something to make this easier than it seems.

I will most likely shoot for the Red Planet. Not really sure why. It's that or Eve and later on when i get more experienced in interplanetary travel i will head for one of the green planets' moons and maybe even smash into the green planet to see what would happen!
I'll most likely aim for the innermost planet... then send some kerbals into the sun instead.
First to land on? Idk I'll probably land on one of the Gas Giants moons since I plan to be over there first with a bunch of satellites practicing getting to planets

This should be in the general discussion section, not off-topic. Just saying.

Does anyone acknowledge this?

Edited August 31, 2012 by AeroPelican
Desert Planet! I have a Kuriosity rover designed just for it. The link in my sig.
I will try to land on the lava planet and get a nice view of the new sun and the other failed missions and rocket parts scatter through out the landscape
ill probably send unmanned probes to every planet, then decide later for a manned mission
I think I will crash into Jool.
I pretty much would go to the first one that I arrive near.
Just so people know: Charr is now Moho, the Desert Planet is Duna, and the gas giant is Jool. Supposedly.

I will sling myself out and just sit back, Flip the warp, and watch the kerbals as they either fly into the sun or get somewhere....Eventually....

Im hoping on Duna though.

Or atleast Jool.

Maybe Eve...

Or just crash somewhere and go "Good enough...Good enough".
